;;伊朗媒体称，在烟雾升起后，伊朗国旗悬挂周一，以色列袭击了叙利亚大马士革伊朗大使馆附近的一座建筑。照片：路透社 ;
;

;官方媒体称，在加沙战争导致地区紧张局势加剧之际，以色列周一袭击了叙利亚首都的伊朗领事馆附属建筑，战争监测员报告称，有八人死亡。

;

;伊朗官方媒体称，强大的伊斯兰革命卫队圣城军高级指挥官穆罕默德·礼萨·扎赫迪准将也在遇难者之列。

;

;这是八次袭击中的第五次袭击叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德得到伊朗及其盟友的广泛支持。以色列没有立即发表评论，但随着以色列加大对伊朗的打击力度，这一事件将进一步加剧紧张局势-在加沙对抗哈马斯的战争期间与武装团体有关联。

;
;;
;;伊朗媒体称伊朗驻伊朗大使馆附近的一座建筑遭到袭击叙利亚大马士革周一遭到以色列袭击。图片来源：路透社;
;
;

;法新社记者在现场证实，位于大马士革高档社区的使馆旁边的附属建筑已被夷为平地。;

;法新社图片显示，在一个有围栏的院落旁边，有一堆约两层楼高的瓦砾。

;

;伊朗媒体还报道称，大马士革的空袭完全摧毁了附属建筑，大使没有受伤。

;

;“伊朗伊斯兰共和国驻大马士革大使侯赛因·阿克巴里及其家人在以色列的袭击中没有受伤，”伊朗努尔通讯社称。

;

;英国叙利亚人权观察组织表示：“以色列导弹......摧毁了伊朗驻大马士革大使馆的附属建筑，造成六人死亡”，初步死亡人数迅速上升至八人。

;

;叙利亚有 19 名松露猎人被地雷炸死

;

;叙利亚国防部表示，以色列的袭击造成许多人“受伤、死亡”，叙利亚外交部长费萨尔·迈克达德在视察现场后谴责了这次袭击。< /p>;

;“我们强烈谴责这起针对伊朗驻大马士革领事馆大楼的令人发指的恐怖袭击，造成许多无辜者死亡，”迈克达德在官方媒体 SANA 发表的一份声明中表示。

;

;SANA 早些时候报道称，“我们的防空系统在大马士革附近遭遇了敌方目标”。

;

;以色列对叙利亚目标的袭击，主要是叙利亚军队阵地以及包括黎巴嫩真主党运动战士在内的伊朗支持的战斗人员，自 10 月以色列开始在加沙地带与真主党结盟的哈马斯武装分子作战以来，这种冲突愈演愈烈。

;

;哈马斯和真主党都得到了以色列的头号敌人伊朗的支持。

;
;;
;< small style="color: #999;">;叙利亚外交部长费萨尔·迈克达德在伊朗媒体称周一以色列袭击了叙利亚大马士革伊朗大使馆附近的一栋建筑后，走在受损地点附近。照片：路透社;
;
;

;真主党和以色列军队几乎每天都在黎巴嫩边境交火。

;

;大马士革事件发生在观察站三天后据报道，以色列的空袭造成叙利亚 53 人死亡，其中包括 38 名士兵和 7 名伊朗支持的真主党成员。

;

;这是自 10 月 7 日以色列-加沙战争开始以来，以色列空袭中叙利亚军队伤亡最高的一次”，监测员说。

;

;“从以色列的角度来看，叙利亚和黎巴嫩已经成为一个延伸的战场，”近东和海湾军事分析研究所所长里亚德·卡瓦吉 (Riad Kahwaji) 在周五之后告诉法新社。

;

;“以色列战机几乎每天都会袭击两国的目标，持续摧毁真主党的军事基础设施并玷污该组织的形象，”他说。

;

;“以色列的袭击他补充说，黎巴嫩的“规模和深度明显升级”。

;苏格兰受害者和社区安全部长表示，根据周一生效的新仇恨犯罪法，人们“可能会因在网上误判某人性别而受到调查”。

;

;苏格兰议会 (MSP) 成员于 2021 年通过了《仇恨犯罪和公共秩序（苏格兰）法案》，巩固了现有的仇恨犯罪立法，并设立了一项新的煽动针对受保护特征的仇恨的罪行，尽管性别已被省略旨在解决厌女症问题的独立法案。

;

;当被问及根据新法律在互联网上对某人进行性别歧视是否构成犯罪时，苏格兰受害者和社区安全部长西奥比安·布朗 (Siobhian Brown) 告诉 BBC 广播 4 台的《今日节目》：“评估发生的情况将是警方的事情。

;

;“可以举报并调查 - 警方是否认为这是犯罪行为取决于苏格兰警方。”

;

;苏格兰前领导人斯特金在被捕后声称无罪

;

;艾尔州议会议员补充道：“该法案中的门槛非常高，这将由苏格兰警察决定，并且必须采取什么措施在网上或当面说这将是威胁和辱骂。”

;

;当被问及为什么女性没有被纳入新立法时，布朗说：“我们将通过我们的厌女症法案进一步保护女性，这将在议会中制定。”

;

;人权活动家 Peter Tatchell 在同一节目中表示，新法律中将妇女排除在外是“令人惊讶的排除”。

;

;他补充道：“这项法案的最大缺陷是它不能保护女性免受仇恨。”

;

;塔切尔还批评了允许第三方举报的新法律。

;

;他说：“匿名如果获得批准，这可能会为无理取闹和恶意的投诉者打开大门，他们会追捕人们并利用第三方中心作为报复人们的一种方式。”

;

;南亚人在英国政治中的崛起吗？由于多样性或财富的增加？

;已故演艺界和歌坛传奇人物张国荣的粉丝周一聚集在香港，向这位21年前自杀的明星致敬，其中包括一些远至法国和中国西部的新疆。

;

;中环文华酒店内摆满了鲜花，这位与抑郁症作斗争的 46 岁歌手于 2003 年在酒店跳楼身亡，而许多人还涌向红磡的摄影展和他在沙田的最后安息地。

;

;在东铁南行列车上也进行了纪念活动，两名粉丝在车上摆放了带有照片的白色和黄色花束。车厢内地板上的名人头像。

;
;;
;;粉丝在中环文华东方酒店外为张国荣献花。摄影：Sam Tsang;
;
;

;29岁的舞蹈老师李翔计划从深圳出发一日游，参观展览和展览和酒店。

;

;“我觉得他去了他所属的地方。但知道世界上曾经存在过这样的人对我来说是一种真正的安慰，帮助我减轻了日常忙碌的压力。”李说，他是通过电影《英雄本色》第一次认识这位艺术家的。

;

;24岁的云南人马杰表示，他从六岁开始听张艺谋的歌曲，并计划今年大学毕业后第一次亲自到香港拜祭偶像。

;

;“在香港一定是 4 月 1 日。这个日期和这个地点。被这么多爱张的人包围着让我感觉很特别。”参观了展览和安葬张的沙田宝福山的马云说道。

;

;20 世纪 80 年代香港电影：周润发-肥胖片、黑帮片和成人片

;

;红磡的展览是由张三兄弟举办的，他们都是张的粉丝。

;

;“今年咖啡店向我们伸出了援手， “我们认为这是有纪念意义的，因为张老师以前也开过一家咖啡店。”展览工作人员Carol Cheng说道。

;

;“虽然今年场地较小，但还是有很多粉丝前来参观。在此表示敬意。周末我见到了来自日本、韩国、马来西亚和法国的粉丝。很多内地粉丝来自深圳、广州，还有一些来自内蒙古、新疆等其他省份的粉丝。

;
;;
;;火车上的两名粉丝拿着鲜花和已故巨星的照片。相片：莫丹尼;
;
;

;50岁的本地参观者黄文文表示，去年她帮一些内地粉丝支付了拍摄纪念照的费用，并受邀参加加入了一个拥有300多名会员的微信粉丝群，大家都分享了张国荣的生活信息。

;

;“几年前，我对张国荣在中国大陆拥有如此庞大的粉丝群感到有点惊讶，”黄说。 “我真的很欣赏他们的热情和坚持。他们中的一些人每年都会前往香港参加各种纪念活动。”

;

;

;During Monday's meeting, Wang focused on Beijing's concerns that Europe has been “de-risking” its supply chains to reduce its dependence on China.

;

;“We hope that together with Europe, we will adhere to the policies of openness, support free trade and maintain the stability of the global industrial supply chain,” Wang said.

;
;
;

;He also said China would like to buy more French products and services and provide a better operating environment for French companies in China. In return, Wang said, he hoped France would provide a “fair, just and predictable” business environment for Chinese firms.

;

;Wang was also asked about a European Union probe into subsidies for Chinese electric vehicle makers that might result in new import duties. He responded by saying: “Only openness leads to progress, isolation only leads to backwardness.”

;

;Séjourné said he had told Wang “that it is not desirable to decouple from China”. He said the European Union was still open to Chinese investment but wanted to “de-risk” the relationship after the Covid-19 pandemic and Ukraine war had highlighted the dangers of being over reliant on one market.

;

;Wang said the two countries will continue cooperation in areas such as aerospace, nuclear energy, agriculture, finance, green energy, as well as science, education, sports, cultural heritage, as “our common interests far outweigh our differences”.

;A Dubai prince who abruptly postponed the inauguration ceremony of his US$500 million family office in Hong Kong has issued a third statement in four days to show his commitment to proceeding with the plan.

;

;Monday's statement largely echoed one of the two published on Friday, with the latest announcement stressing that Sheikh Ali Rashed Ali Saeed Al Maktoum's family office reserved the right to take legal action against any false information.

;

;It also reiterated the opening ceremony for the prince's family office was postponed until the end of May, when Maktoum would make a return visit to the city.

;

;“It has been confirmed that the operation of the sheikh's family office in Hong Kong will proceed as planned,” said Eleanor Jane Mak, the office's vice-chairman and CEO.

;

;“It is merely the inauguration ceremony that has been planned and will now be postponed until the sheikh comes to Hong Kong again at the end of May.”

;

;The ceremony was abruptly postponed last week, with the office at the time saying the sheikh had “some urgent unexpected private matters” in the United Arab Emirates. It did not elaborate further on the situation.

;

;Maktoum has been thrust into the media spotlight after he pledged to open a US$500 million family office in Hong Kong and gave several high-profile appearances.

;

;The family office has also set up an official website and email, earlier saying both will be used for public announcements and to ensure transparency and accountability for all future communications.

;

;“We reserve the right to take legal action against any false information or factually incorrect information,” it said on Monday.

;
;;
;;Maktoum and the Eleanor Jane Mak (right), the office's vice-chairman and CEO, sign registration documents in Dubai in February. Photo: Handout;
;
;

;The office repeated its apology for any inconvenience caused to all parties and the Hong Kong government over the ceremony's postponement, expressing its “sincere gratitude” for the support and concern from various stakeholders.

;

;The office was “very interested” in development opportunities in mainland China, Hong Kong and Asia, it said.

;

;The prince's representatives had also visited various mainland areas and cities, including the Greater Bay Area, to explore new business opportunities, according to the office.

;

;The bay area refers to Beijing's ambitious plan to integrate Hong Kong, Macau and nine mainland cities into an economic powerhouse.

;

;

;“The directors and our office are committed to fostering global partnerships and pursuing investment opportunities that contribute to the prosperity and ecological health of the world,” the office said.

;

;The second statement from Friday highlighted Maktoum's focus on promoting sustainable business ties between the UAE and Asia, as well as citing his recent appointment as an honorary professor in sustainability leadership by the Hang Seng University of Hong Kong.

;

;The Dubai prince's ambitious investment plan attracted considerable attention and interest from mainland enterprises, but some had said they could find little public information about him.

;

;Two sources with knowledge of the royals previously said Maktoum was from a “distant branch” of the ruling family.

;

;

;The UAE consulate earlier confirmed he was “from the ruling family” and “a sheikh” – an honorific title designating a royal family member.

;

;Hong Kong has set its sights on becoming a wealth management and family office hub for Asia, with the government aiming to attract 200 new family offices to the city by 2025.

;

;Last year, the government announced plans to develop family office businesses in Hong Kong, introducing a range of measures that sought to create a “conducive and competitive environment”.

;

;Among them was the exemption of profits tax, which was introduced in May of last year.

;
;;
;;The sheikh's family office now plans to launch in May, it has said. Photo: Sam Tsang;
;
;

;Under the arrangement, the city waives a 16.5 per cent tax on profits generated from global stocks, bonds and other qualified investments by family offices set up in Hong Kong.

;

;To receive this incentive, such firms must have an investment portfolio valued at HK$240 million (US$30.7 million), two employees in Hong Kong who may or may not be locals, and annual operating expenses of at least HK$2 million.

;

;Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po said in his budget speech last year that the government had allocated HK$100 million to promote family offices and other wealth-management businesses.

;

;The development of the family office sector would also be conducive to pooling capital from around the world in Hong Kong, he said at the time.
